Package gg.sep.alyx.plugin.replies

Class InteractiveActions

  • java.lang.Object
    • gg.sep.alyx.plugin.replies.InteractiveActions
  • public final class InteractiveActions
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class which contains helpers for building common "interactive" wizard-like interactions with Discord, such as requiring a user to choose a true/false/confirm/deny answer, and return that response back to the calling command.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> yesOrNo​(Alyx alyx, net.dv8tion.jda.api.events.message.MessageReceivedEvent event, java.lang.String message, java.time.Duration timeout)
      Starts a Yes/No interactive session.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • yesOrNo

        public static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> yesOrNo​(Alyx alyx,
                                                                                net.dv8tion.jda.api.events.message.MessageReceivedEvent event,
                                                                                java.lang.String message,
                                                                                java.time.Duration timeout)
        Starts a Yes/No interactive session. This action will send the message into the channel which triggered (contained on the event). It will then ask the user to choose a true/false (yes/no, confirm/deny, etc) response and will wait up until the given timeout for a response.

        By default, this method will attempt to use checkmark/X reaction emojis to record the response. If permissions are not available to do so, it will instead wait for a text y or n response from the triggering user in the same channel as the message.

        A future eventually containing a Boolean representing the user's response is immediately sent back to caller. The caller can decide what to do with this future (block until complete, follow up with a callback).

        If the timeout is reached and no response has been recorded, the future's data will null.
        Parameters:
        alyx - The instance of Alyx which triggered this action.
        event - The message event which triggered the action.
        message - The message (question, etc) to present to the user along with the question.
        timeout - The maximum duration to wait for a valid response event.
        Returns:
        A future containing the result of a yes/no response (true/false), or null if the timeout was reached before a response was received.
